title: Convert to PWA and change application name

requirements.summary: Configure the application as a Progressive Web App (PWA) with manifest file containing app metadata, icons, theme colors, and standalone display mode
acceptanceCriteria: A manifest.json file exists in frontend/public with proper PWA configuration
Manifest includes app name, short_name, description, theme_color, background_color, display: 'standalone', and start_url
Manifest is linked in index.html with appropriate meta tags

file_operations.description: Create PWA manifest file with app name, short_name, description, theme_color matching the warm earthy palette, background_color, display set to 'standalone', start_url set to '/', scope set to '/', and icons array referencing the generated PWA icons at frontend/public/assets/generated/pwa-icon-192.dim_192x192.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/pwa-icon-512.dim_512x512.png

Add manifest link tag (<link rel="manifest" href="/manifest.json">) in the head section, add theme-color meta tag matching the primary color from the warm palette, and add apple-touch-icon meta tags for iOS compatibility referencing the 192x192 generated icon

requirements.summary: Implement service worker for PWA functionality enabling offline capability, caching strategies, and installation prompts
acceptanceCriteria: Service worker file is created and registered in the application
Basic caching strategy is implemented for static assets
Application can be installed to device home screen
Install prompt appears on supported browsers

file_operations.description: Create service worker implementing cache-first strategy for static assets (JS, CSS, fonts, images), network-first strategy for API calls, install event handler for initial cache population, activate event handler for old cache cleanup, and fetch event handler for request interception

Add service worker registration logic after React root render, checking for navigator.serviceWorker support, registering /service-worker.js, and handling registration success/failure with console logging

Create custom React hook that listens for beforeinstallprompt event, stores the prompt event, provides installPWA function to trigger the prompt, tracks installation state, and returns installation status and install function for UI integration

Import and use the usePWAInstall hook, conditionally render an install button in the navigation bar when the app is installable, trigger the install prompt when clicked, and hide the button after successful installation

requirements.summary: Wire generated PWA icon assets into the application manifest and ensure proper display when installed to home screen
acceptanceCriteria: Icon files are generated and placed in frontend/public/assets/generated
Icons are referenced in the manifest.json
Icons display correctly when app is installed to home screen

file_operations.description: Ensure the icons array includes entries for frontend/public/assets/generated/pwa-icon-192.dim_192x192.png with size 192x192 and type image/png, and frontend/public/assets/generated/pwa-icon-512.dim_512x512.png with size 512x512 and type image/png, with purpose set to 'any maskable' for adaptive icon support

requirements.summary: Update the application name throughout the frontend codebase to the user's preferred name
acceptanceCriteria: Application name is updated in index.html title tag
Application name is updated in PWA manifest
Application name is updated in Navigation component
All user-facing references to the app name are consistent

file_operations.description: Update the <title> tag to reflect the new application name chosen by the user (to be determined during implementation)
Update the name and short_name fields in the manifest to match the new application name chosen by the user
Update the displayed application title text in the navigation header to match the new application name chosen by the user
